item.title: 公司已计划美国东海岸港口罢工
item.description: 10 月 1 日，约 45,000 名工会工人在美国东海岸和海湾地区的海港罢工，在美国总统大选前几周切断了重要的贸易通道。【原文：Some 45,000 union workers walked off the job at seaports on the U.S. East and Gulf Coasts on Oct. 1, cutting off vital trade arteries just weeks ahead of the nation's presidential election.】

item.title: 浏览器安全初创公司 Menlo 年经常性收入达 1 亿美元
item.description: Menlo Security 公司首席执行官 Amir Ben-Efraim 在接受采访时说，该公司的年度经常性收入 (ARR) 已超过 1 亿美元，比上一年增长了约 30%，预计到 2025 年将实现现金流正增长。【原文：Menlo Security's annual recurring revenue (ARR) has exceeded $100 million, rising by about 30% from the prior year, CEO Amir Ben-Efraim said in an interview, and expects to be cash flow positive by 2025.】

item.title: 早间竞标：通胀放缓为降息埋下伏笔
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 美国东海岸码头工人在协议最后期限过后举行罢工
item.description: 美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸的码头工人预计将于周二上午举行罢工，因为午夜最后期限已过，但没有迹象表明他们与港口业主达成了新的合同协议。预计罢工将导致全国约一半的远洋运输停顿。【原文：Dockworkers on the U.S. East Coast and Gulf Coast were expected to strike on Tuesday morning after a midnight deadline passed with no sign of a new contract deal with port owners. The strike is forecast to halt about half the nation's ocean shipping.】

item.title: 如果中国摆脱对真菌的担忧，澳大利亚将成为油菜籽贸易赢家
item.description: 如果中国对加拿大进口的油菜籽征收关税，澳大利亚很可能成为全球油菜籽贸易流向变化的赢家，但中国政府需要克服对真菌的担忧。【原文：Australia would be the likely winner from a shift in global canola trade flows should China impose tariffs on Canadian imports of the oilseed, but Beijing will need to overcome their worries about a fungus.】

item.title: 消息人士透露，澳大利亚央行禁止加拿大投资银行参加私人简报会
item.description: 两位知情人士周二表示，澳大利亚央行已禁止加拿大全球投资银行参加机密简报会，因为该银行的一位客户泄露了一次闭门简报会的细节。【原文：Australia's central bank has barred Canada's global investment bank from confidential briefings after one of its clients leaked details from a closed door briefing, two sources aware of the decision said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 全球不确定性打击亚洲工厂活动，中国刺激政策受关注
item.description: 民间调查显示，由于中国需求疲软和全球经济不确定性导致前景充满挑战，亚洲工厂活动在9月份有所减弱，使政策制定者面临支撑其脆弱经济的压力。【原文：Asia's factory activity weakened in September as soft Chinese demand and global economic uncertainty pointed to a challenging outlook, private surveys showed, keeping policymakers under pressure to shore up their fragile economies.】

item.title: 亚洲股市放缓，美元走强，交易员思考美国利率问题
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市在两年半高点附近有所回落，美联储主席鲍威尔发表鹰派言论，打消了大幅降息的赌注，美元走强，而中东紧张局势则抑制了风险情绪。【原文：Asian stocks eased near two-and-half-year highs on Tuesday and the U.S. dollar firmed following hawkish comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that scuppered bets of big interest rate cuts, while Mid-East tension kept risk sentiment in check.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 8 月零售销售因温暖天气而反弹
item.description: 澳大利亚零售业在经历了 7 月份的疲软之后，8 月份出现了超预期的反弹，原因是异常温暖的天气使春季消费提前，这可能表明消费者正在动用近期减税带来的额外收入。【原文：Australian retail sales rebounded more than expected in August after a soft July as unusually warm weather brought forward spring spending, a possible sign consumers are dipping into extra income from recent tax cuts.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 8 月零售销售反弹 0.7
item.description: 澳大利亚零售销售在经历了 7 月份的疲软之后，8 月份的反弹幅度超过预期，原因是异常温暖的天气使春季消费提前，这可能表明消费者正在动用近期大幅减税带来的额外收入。【原文：Australian retail sales rebounded by more than expected in August after a soft July as unusually warm weather brought forward spring spending, a possible sign consumers are dipping into extra income from recent sizable tax cuts.】

item.title: 鲍威尔推翻激进宽松政策押注后美元坚挺
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）隔夜推翻了对更大规模降息的押注后，美元兑主要货币汇率周二上涨。【原文：The U.S. dollar gained against major peers on Tuesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell pushed back overnight against bets on more supersized interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 供应增加的前景抵消了对中东冲突的担忧，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 周二，油价持稳，因为在全球需求增长乏力的情况下，额外供应进入市场的前景抵消了人们对不断升级的中东冲突可能扰乱主要产油地区出口的担忧。【原文：Oil prices were steady on Tuesday as the prospect of additional supply entering the market amid lacklustre global demand growth offset concerns that the escalating Middle East conflict could disrupt exports in the key producing region.】

item.title: 日本制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，需求疲软导致日本工厂活动低迷
item.description: 周二的一项私营部门调查显示，由于经济疲软和海外需求不足，日本 9 月份的工厂活动低迷，产出和新订单均出现萎缩。【原文：Japan's factory activity was subdued in September as output and new orders contracted due to a weak economy and lacklustre overseas demand, a private-sector survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 9 月摘要显示，日本央行决策者讨论了谨慎加息的必要性
item.description: 周二，日本央行的一份九月份会议纪要显示，日本央行决策者讨论了近期加息需要谨慎的问题，其中一些人对不稳定的金融市场和美国经济前景表示担忧。【原文：Bank of Japan policymakers discussed the need for caution over near-term interest rate hikes with some voicing concern over unstable financial markets and the U.S. economic outlook, a summary of their September meeting showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本央行银行间金融市场调查显示：第三季度日本大型制造商情绪稳定
item.description: 日本央行周二进行的一项备受关注的调查显示，截至 9 月份的三个月中，日本大型制造商的经营情绪稳定，这表明尽管全球经济增长疲软，但日本经济仍在继续复苏。【原文：Japanese big manufacturers' business sentiment was steady in the three months to September, a closely watched central bank survey showed on Tuesday, a sign the economy continues to recover despite weakness in global growth.】

item.title: 亚马逊赢得美国联邦贸易委员会反垄断诉讼的部分驳回
item.description: 根据在华盛顿州西雅图市提交的联邦法院记录，亚马逊赢得了美国联邦贸易委员会反垄断诉讼的部分驳回。【原文：Amazon has won partial dismissal of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's antitrust lawsuit, according to federal court records filed in Seattle, Washington.】

item.title: Tapestry 竞购卡普里案美国反垄断审理结束，等待法官裁决
item.description: 奢侈品制造商 Tapestry 出价 85 亿美元收购 Capri 的美国反垄断审判于周一结束，Tapestry 的律师以 "竞争激烈 "的手提包市场为由，对消费者将面临更高的价格这一说法进行了辩护。【原文：The U.S. anti-trust trial over the $8.5 billion bid by luxury goods maker Tapestry to buy Capri concluded on Monday, with Tapestry lawyers citing an "intensely competitive" handbag market in defending against claims that consumers would face higher prices.】

item.title: 日本 8 月失业率降至 2.5%，就业岗位紧缩
item.description: 日本政府周二公布的数据显示，日本 8 月份的失业率从 7 月份的 2.7% 降至 2.5%。【原文：Japan's jobless rate in August fell to 2.5% from 2.7% in July, government data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 索尼影业首席执行官托尼-文琪奎拉卸任
item.description: 索尼影视娱乐公司周二发表声明称，该公司首席执行官托尼-文琪奎拉将于明年初卸任，由首席运营官拉维-阿胡贾（Ravi Ahuja）接任，于 2025 年 1 月 2 日生效。【原文：Sony Pictures Entertainment CEO Tony Vinciquerra will step down from his role at the beginning of next year and will be succeeded by COO Ravi Ahuja effective Jan. 2, 2025, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 公司称墨西哥反垄断监管机构将在未来几天内就沃尔玛业务作出裁决
item.description: 墨西哥反垄断监管机构 Cofece 周一表示，将在未来几天内公布对沃尔玛在该国的业务部门进行调查的决定。【原文：Mexican antitrust regulator Cofece should publish its decision on an investigation into Walmart's unit in the country in the next few days, the firm said on Monday.】

item.title: 全球投资者暂停撤离中国
item.description: 全球投资者正准备再次将赌注押在中国身上，这是中国政府扭转经济放缓、重振股市长期投资兴趣所引发的重大情绪转变。【原文：Global investors are preparing to stake bets on China again, in a major sentiment shift sparked by Beijing's drive to reverse its economic slowdown and revive long term interest in its stock markets.】

item.title: 调查显示，英国商店价格降幅为 2021 年 8 月以来最大
item.description: 英国零售商协会（British Retail Consortium）周二表示，9月份英国商店的价格下降速度为三年多来最快，这进一步表明通胀对消费者的挤压已经减弱。【原文：Prices in British shops fell at the fastest pace in more than three years in September, the British Retail Consortium said on Tuesday, adding to signs that the inflation squeeze on consumers has faded.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，CVS 正在探索包括潜在分拆在内的各种方案
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，CVS Health 正在探索各种方案，其中可能包括拆分公司，将其零售和保险部门分开，因为这家陷入困境的医疗服务公司希望在投资者的压力下扭转颓势。【原文：CVS Health is exploring options that could include a break-up of the company to separate its retail and insurance units, as the struggling healthcare services company looks to turn around its fortunes amid pressure from investors, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 文件显示，23andMe 首席执行官沃西基不再接受第三方收购建议
item.description: 周一的一份监管文件显示，基因检测公司23andMe首席执行官安妮-沃西基（Anne Wojcicki）不再愿意考虑第三方对公司的收购建议。【原文：Genetic testing firm 23andMe Chief Executive Officer Anne Wojcicki would no longer be open to considering third-party takeover proposals for the company, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.】

item.title: 巴西和墨西哥着眼于修订贸易协定
item.description: 巴西和墨西哥当局周一表示，他们认为有必要修订和扩大两国现有的贸易协定，以加强这两个拉丁美洲最大经济体之间的联系。【原文：Brazilian and Mexican authorities said on Monday they see the need to revise and expand their current trade agreements, in a push to strengthen the ties between the two largest economies in Latin America.】

item.title: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司瞄准墨西哥的防务飞机销售访问
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）负责人周一表示，该公司将墨西哥视为其超级巨嘴鸟（Super Tucano）和 C-390 防务飞机的主要市场。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer views Mexico as a prime market for its Super Tucano and C-390 defense aircraft, the company's head said on Monday.】

item.title: 特斯拉和马斯克击败股东对自动驾驶承诺的诉讼
item.description: 特斯拉及其首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周一赢得了一项诉讼的撤诉，该诉讼指控他们为了提高股价，夸大了汽车制造商自动驾驶技术的有效性和安全性，从而欺骗了股东。【原文：Tesla and its CEO Elon Musk on Monday won the dismissal of a lawsuit accusing them of defrauding shareholders by overstating the effectiveness and safety of the automaker's self-driving technology in order to boost its stock price.】

item.title: 早间竞价：谨慎的鲍威尔和中国的喘息为第四季度开盘奠定了基础
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国为战略石油储备购买 600 万桶石油
item.description: 美国能源部周一表示，美国已为战略石油储备购买了 600 万桶石油，将一直供应到 2025 年 5 月。【原文：The U.S. has bought 6 million barrels of oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve for delivery through May 2025, the Department of Energy said on Monday.】

item.title: 车队工会与赫兹达成临时协议，避免罢工
item.description: 车队工会周一表示，已与汽车租赁公司赫兹全球达成临时协议，避免了可能发生的罢工。【原文：Teamsters has reached a tentative agreement with car-rental firm Hertz Global , averting a potential strike, the labor union said on Monday.】
